III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Two youth engaged in a physical altercation over a disagreement
in a basketball game that escalated. Staff broke the altercation up
after 15 seconds, but one youth sustained two broken bones.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was emailed on 01/14/2025. Complainant does not
have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 01/17/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Youth A was observed wearing a splint and sling on
his left arm. Youth A stated his left arm was not in pain and a cast
would be placed on his left arm on 01/17/2025. Youth A stated he
injured his left arm in the gym when he and Youth B argued over a
basketball game. Youth A stated he did not recall the specifics of
their argument. Youth A stated he got up from the ground and
swung at Youth B when Youth B charged towards him. Youth A
stated Youth B swung back and pushed Youth A to the ground
and then kicked Youth A’s left wrist. Youth A stated staff (does not
recall who) immediately intervened and took Youth A out of the
gym. Youth A stated he saw a nurse and went to the hospital for
his left arm injury. Youth A stated he did not recall further details
of the incident.
Youth B was interviewed on 01/17/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Youth B stated he played basketball with Youth C
after Youth A lost to Youth C. Youth B stated Youth A was upset
and sat on the basketball court side watching them play. Youth B
stated Youth A began name calling Youth B with “Bitch ass nigga.”
Youth B stated he became upset, walked towards Youth A and
they began to swing on each other at the same time. Youth B
stated Youth A went to the ground on his side and Youth B went
to the ground on his knees. Youth B stated Staff 1 immediately
2

helped him up and escorted him out of the gym and another staff
(does not recall who) immediately intervened with Youth A. Youth
B stated he was not injured in this incident.
Youth C was interviewed on 01/17/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Youth C stated he played one on one basketball with
Youth A and Youth A lost. Youth C stated Youth A sat on the side
of the basketball court and said, “Bitch ass nigga” to either him or
Youth B. Youth C stated Youth B started to fight Youth A and they
went down to the ground. Youth C stated Staff 1 and another staff
immediately intervened and Staff 1 took Youth B out of the gym.
Youth C stated he did not recall further details and stated he did
not want to see Youth A and Youth B fight.
Youth D was interviewed on 02/10/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Youth D stated she was in the gym when a female
staff (does not recall who) redirected Youth A to calm down and
for Youth B to ignore Youth A because they were arguing about
basketball. Youth D stated Youth A sat down on the side of the
basketball court and Youth B walked up and hit Youth A. Youth D
stated Youth A did not fall to the ground and did not hit Youth B
back. Youth D stated Staff 1 immediately separated Youth A and
Youth B and two other female staff (does not recall who) also
intervened. Youth D stated the incident ended and everyone left
the gym.
Youth E was interviewed on 02/10/2025 by phone because she
was discharged from Mott Childrens Residence in 01/2025. Youth
E stated Youth A directed profanity towards Youth B while Youth
B played basketball with Youth C. Youth E stated Youth B
approached Youth A, who was sitting on the side of the basketball
court by Youth E. Youth E stated Youth A stood up and Youth B
swung at Youth A. Youth E stated Youth A went to the ground and
Youth B kicked Youth A’s arm. Youth A stated the female staff
(does not recall who) in the gym verbally redirected Youth A and
Youth B when they argued and then separated them when they
started to swing at each other.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 01/17/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Staff 1 stated Youth C won the basketball game with
Youth A. Staff 1 stated Youth A became upset and started yelling,
“Fuck you. Bitch ass nigga. I beat your ass.” Staff 1 stated Youth
B became upset and challenged Youth A to fight. Staff 1 stated
Youth A did not follow verbal redirection to stop with his remarks
and to go back to the unit. Staff 1 stated Youth B said, “Your dad
don’t like you” to Youth A and Youth A got up from his seated
3

position on the gym floor. Staff 1 stated Youth B threw the
basketball at Youth A, ran to Youth A and both swung at each
other and fell to the ground. Staff 1 stated she approached Youth
B from behind when he kicked Youth A and escorted him away
from Youth A. Staff 1 stated she took Youth B back to the unit.
Staff 1 stated she was focused on Youth B and did not see what
happened with Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 02/03/2025 by phone. Staff 2 stated
Youth A and Youth B shot basketballs in the gym. Staff 2 stated
Youth A walked away and sat down on the side of the basketball
court against the wall when she redirected Youth B for being
aggressive with the basketball. Staff 2 stated Youth B threw the
basketball at the wall next to Youth A’s head as they exchanged
words. Staff 2 stated she redirected Youth A and Youth B to
ignore each other but Youth A stood up and Youth B swung at
him. Staff 2 stated Youth A went to the ground and Youth B kicked
Youth A. Staff 2 stated Medical Aid immediately helped Youth A
up and took him to the nurse and Staff 1 immediately escorted
Youth B away from Youth A and took him back to the unit.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 02/10/2025 by phone. Staff 3 stated
Youth A said, “I don’t wanna play with bitch ass nigga” in
reference to Youth B. Staff 3 stated she verbally redirected Youth
A and Youth A repeated the phrase louder. Staff 3 stated Youth B
heard the comment and started to exchange words with Youth A.
Staff 3 stated she redirected Youth B to not go back and forth with
Youth A. Staff 3 stated Youth B kicked Youth A’s leg and Youth A
fell to the ground. Staff 3 stated Staff 1 and Medical Aid
immediately went towards Youth A and Youth B and separated
them without issue. Staff 3 stated that everyone (Youth A, Youth
B, Youth C, Youth D, Youth E, Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3 and Medical
Aid) left the gym and the incident ended.
Medical Aid was interviewed on 01/31/2025 at Mott Childrens
Residence. Medical Aid stated she gave Youth E her medication
in the gym. Medical Aid stated Youth A became agitated when he
lost a basketball game and started a negative verbal exchange
with Youth B. Medical Aid stated Youth A said, “Beat your ass
bitch” and Youth B said, “That’s why you don’t get unsupervised
visits.” Medical Aid stated Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 3 verbally
redirected Youth A and Youth B. Medical Aid stated Youth B threw
a basketball towards Youth A, ran towards Youth A and they
started to swing at each other and fell to the ground. Medical Aid
stated she immediately went towards Youth A and helped him up.
4

Medical Aid stated she took Youth A to the nursing office and
Youth A went to urgent care for evaluation of his left arm.
Video
01/12/2025 video of the gym does not have sound. Youth B and
Youth C are on the basketball court. Youth A is sitting against the
wall on a basketball and facing the basketball court. Staff 1, Staff
2, Staff 3, Medical Aid, Youth D and Youth E are sitting or
standing by Youth A. Youth A and Youth B exchange words as
Youth B and Youth C shoot baskets. Youth B unzips and takes off
his hoodie and runs towards Youth A. Youth A stands up. Youth A
and Youth B swing their arms at each other. Youth A goes to the
ground on his left side. Staff 1 runs to Youth B as Youth B kicks
Youth A twice. Staff 1 guides Youth B to turn around and escorts
him off the basketball court without resistance from Youth B. At
the same time, Medical Aid runs to Youth A, helps him get up from
the ground and escorts him to the gym door without resistance
from Youth A. The incident starts and ends within 15 seconds at
3:40 PM.
Documentation
Staff 2 wrote incident reports dated 01/12/2025 for Youth A and
Youth B’s physical altercation. Incidents reports coincide with the
staff interviews.
Youth A was taken to Hurley Medical Center Urgent Care on
01/12/2025. Youth A was diagnosed with a left wrist fracture.
Youth A received a short arm cast on 01/17/2025 for his left wrist
from Ortho Now. Youth A is restricted from bearing weight on his
left arm.
Staff 1 last completed Therapeutic Crisis Intervention training on
8/28/2024.
Medical Assistant last completed Therapeutic Crisis Intervention
training on 11/19/2024.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance in providing for the needs,
supervision of Youth A. Staff 1 and Medical Assistant immediately
intervened in Youth A and Youth B’s physical altercation. Youth A
was evaluated and treated for his fractured left wrist.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
